definition: to split/to crack/to break open/to rend
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: The soldiers used their bodies to plug up a hole in the dyke.
sentences.chinese: 战士们用身体堵住大堤的裂口。

sentences.english: The broken heteromorphic cells were found in the part of longitudinal split.
sentences.chinese: 部分纵裂部位有裂口异形细胞。

sentences.english: Then I go clockwise along the inside curve, then back along the slit.
sentences.chinese: 再顺时针沿着里面的曲线走，又回到这个裂口。

sentences.english: Water spouted from the break of the pipe.
Mars and nicks aren't very important.
sentences.chinese: 火星和裂口不非常重要。

sentences.english: Your wound is as deep as the sea. Who can heal you?
sentences.chinese: 因为你的裂口大如海，谁能医治你呢？

sentences.english: First, the medical term for a cut or tear in the skin is a laceration.
sentences.chinese: 首先，这种皮肤的切口或裂口在医学上称为撕裂伤。

sentences.english: She sewed up the rip in his sleeve.
sentences.chinese: 她缝好了他衣袖上的裂口。

sentences.english: The holes in the walls were turning into big gaps.
sentences.chinese: 墙上的小窟窿成了大裂口。

sentences.english: Clefts are often associated with other more serious congenital defects.
sentences.chinese: 裂口常与其他更严重的先天性异常并发。

sentences.english: With tears in her coat she burst into tears.
sentences.chinese: 她上衣有裂口，便放声大哭了起来。

sentences.english: The laceration doesn't look too serious.
Many years passed as the Warlocks sought to unlock the mysteries of this tiny rift.
sentences.chinese: 术士花了许多年寻找扩大这个微小裂口的神秘方法。

sentences.english: It is also found that the spall and fine cleft are due to local melting of heavy rail tread.
sentences.chinese: 缺损和小裂口则是因重轨踏面局部熔融所造成的。

sentences.english: The os will have a fish-mouth shape after one or more pregnancies.
sentences.chinese: 一次或多次生育后，宫颈外口呈现鱼嘴样裂口。

sentences.english: for thy breach is great like the sea: who can heal thee?
sentences.chinese: 因为你的裂口大如海，谁能医治你呢。

definition: to rupture/to burst open/to break up
tear or rupture/to have a tear (e.g. in one's clothes)/without restraint (e.g. of swearing)
bloody mouth (from devouring freshly killed prey)
hole/opening/cut/gap/gash/my husband or wife/classifier for people (used for indicating the number of people in a family etc)/precedent
